file_content.text: Ah, hello. My name is--was--Arick Tamso. My colleagues and I were looking for a way to pacify the Colicoids. We failed.
Doctor Tabo... tampered with the suppressive implants. The Colicoids became more feral... more cunning. They broke free, killing everyone.
Then, Doctor Tabo sealed the rest of us in and fled. I don't have long. The Republic must know about that maniac.
The implants... they'll prove his treachery. Whoever hears this, please... extract the Colicoid implants and take them to my brother, Pol, at Sundari Outpost....
Ah, I'm afraid I'll have to interrupt him here. Don't worry, the rest is just sentimental drivel.
I am Doctor Tabo, the aforementioned "maniac"--though it's a rather specious claim.
You're the one responsible for all these deaths.
You did this.
Oh, I may have taken a few... experimental liberties, but those are hardly my claw marks covering the bodies.
You're not still in this base, are you?
Where are you?
Oh, no, I'm someplace thankfully free of Colicoids. I've simply been keeping an eye on this facility.
Awfully convenient that you survived when everyone else was killed.
How are you still alive?
Survival is nothing if not competitive. I merely put as many bodies between the Colicoids and myself as possible.
I should explain. No doubt you've seen the havoc the Colicoids are capable of.
Instead of pacifying them as the Republic wanted, I sought to harness this savagery and turn it against the Empire.
You sabotaged these people's work.
You won't get away with this.
"Sabotage" is such a strong word. I merely took initiative... with lamentable results.
That's the kind of scheme the Empire would come up with.
You're worse than Imperials.
Morality won't win battles.
The Republic would never condone those underhanded tactics.
That's wrong.
The Republic is shortsighted. If a blaster shot one of their men, they'd deactivate it.
I wasn't born yesterday. You knew what you were doing was wrong.
Don't play innocent.
I knew discretion was called for, yes, but "wrong" and "misunderstood" are hardly the same thing.
It's obvious that something went wrong.
Clearly, you messed up.
Yes, the savagery was certainly there, but the control was somewhat... lacking. An unfortunate miscalculation, but a correctable one.
We need every bit of help we can get against the Empire. This could be big.
Sounds interesting.
My thoughts exactly.
I'm aware that the late Arick Tamso asked you to turn me in. Avenging his death will do nothing to give it meaning.
And yet the carnage that took place here might be justified... if I can finish my research.
I need all evidence of my involvement erased so I may continue my trials elsewhere. Exterminate these Colicoids--and I'll pay you handsomely.
I'm going to turn you in, not help you.
I'm going to expose you.
I see. Well, it's no matter. Those Colicoids will tear you to pieces, anyway.
Okay, I'll help you.
Excellent choice. I'll be waiting at Sundari Outpost with your reward. Don't delay.
